description: Generate random numbers quickly and easily.
Use the break-apart method, in this lesson, to learn how to multiply whole numbers by mixed numbers.
Earn a later bedtime by blasting the clock with the correct analog time on it in Bedtime Bandits.
Shoot the correct digital clock time when it matches your analog clock to earn a high score.
Time to hang out with the bunnies and birds as you turn over cards to match the clock to the watch.
Move the hands on the analog clock to match the time spoken when you set the clock.
It's a race against time! Try to stop the clock by matching the times on analog and digital clocks.
Practice telling time to the nearest hour in this journey through the different ways to read clocks.
Tick Tock, Tick Tock, can you find the time on the clocks in the room?
All of the clocks fell on the floor! Help Clara and her friends get the clocks back on the shelves.
Is it half past four? Use your time-telling skills to compete in this game of giraffe tug-of-war.
Roll the dice, land on the digital clock, and set the analog clock time when you play with a friend.
Hear the whistle sing through the air when you match the time on an analog clock to a digital one.
Match analog to digital time in this multiple choice activity.
Collect objects as you fly through outer space and reset your spaceship clock when it goes haywire.
Click on the minute increments to see the relationship between numbers and analog time.
Recognize
Add and subtract rational expressions with the same denominator while completing practice problems.
Simplify fraction multiplication problems when you learn how to cancel common factors.
Practice identifying 2-D and 3-D figures using angles, side lengths and other properties.
Find both the center and spread for a data set.
Review factor pairs with this Tetris-like game.
Count your new skills when you match the shape to its proper name in this simple game.
Watch this video to learn how to add integers of like signs in a conceptual way.
Reason algebraically as you find the value of a given object based on the information on the scales.
Learn how to translate words in a math problem into an equation, and solve the problem.
Calculate the amount of grass needed for the new soccer fields, by using the formula for area.
Fill the seats in all of the rides of Fun Park so that everyone can enjoy a day of amusement.
Watch this great video to see examples of how to solve linear equations.
Practice adding and subtracting amounts of dollars and cents.
Program a virtual turtle to move in a specific path and change colors.
Learn the formula for the volume of a sphere and a cylinder.
In this lesson, learn how to create a number line and represent the solution set of an inequality.
Help Tally and his friends compare objects on a scale in this fun comparison game.
Fill in the missing numbers and letters in these patterns.
Watch this video explanation of a probability problem related to free throws in a basketball game.
Watch this video for an introduction to random sampling.
Shadows are corrupting the land. Restore the balance of nature by exploring place value.
Find the matching pairs by working out the value of x in each equation to reveal a hidden picture.
Can you match the multiplication facts when you test your memory in this colorful interactive?
In this game, roll the dice and graph the answer to practice basic concepts of multiplication.
Complete the multiplication equation in order to make the equation true as fast as you can.
Quickly determine if a fraction is greater than, less than, or equal to one half.
Use inspection to divide polynomials by binomials with these step-by-step practice problems.
Use the bluebirds to create arrays and solve basic multiplication problems with your friend Tally.
Identify greater than, less than, and equal number relationships in this quick paced game!
Explore how to show that all circles are similar by using similar triangles.
Find out how solve an equation, and discover what the variable equals.
How many problems can you solve in the allotted time? Dash to answer the facts as fast you can.
Count and compare objects, to learn how to write a ratio and express it in its simplest form.
Examine effects of adding or subtracting a constant from a function by how the parabola changes.
Multiply by the reciprocal, in this lesson, to learn how to divide mixed numbers.
Without drawing models, learn how to multiply fractions, in this interactive lesson.
Use models, in this lesson, to learn how to multiply fractions by fractions.
Think about the inverse relationship between multiplication and division when dividing fractions.
Think about equal groups when you learn to divide a fraction by a whole number
The bunnies need your subtraction skills to count how many are left when a few are taken away.
Help Mr. Martini teach his students! Pick either ( + ) or ( - ) to make the equation correct.
Help solve Katie's word problems and see if you can score a Grand Slam!
Watch this video to learn order of operations.
Fill the orders of the hungry diners by combining the right numbers into the pot!
In this lesson, combine horizontal and vertical number lines to learn about the coordinate plane.
In this interactive lesson, look at a number line to learn about the opposite of a number.
Use a coordinate plane, in this lesson, to learn how to reflect points over the x and y axes.
In this interactive lesson, use a coordinate plane to learn how to graph points.
Embrace your inner Isaac Newton when you explore domain, range, and the inverse of a function
Learn all about angles with Tim and Moby.
Help Robot Guy save the planet by identifying acute, obtuse, and right angles.
Apply your vocabulary knowledge of two-dimensional shapes, lines, and angles in this matching game.
Watch a review of mean and standard deviation.
Practice answering questions based on data in a stem-and-leaf plot.
